raw_text: Unlike nouns, many adjectives are inherently subjective, and the number of adjectives in texts correlates with human judgements of their subjectivity (Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe, 2000)
clean_text: Unlike nouns, many adjectives are inherently subjective, and the number of adjectives in texts correlates with human judgements of their subjectivity (Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe, 2000).

citing_paper_authors: Raymond W. M., Yuen | Terence Y. W., Chan | Tom Bong-Yeung, Lai | Oi Yee, Kwong | Benjamin K., T'sou
raw_text: Words that encode a desirable state (e.g., beautiful) have a positive SO, while words that represent undesirable states (e.g. absurd) have a negative SO (Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe, 2000)
clean_text: Words that encode a desirable state (e.g., beautiful) have a positive SO, while words that represent undesirable states (e.g. absurd) have a negative SO (Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe, 2000).

raw_text: Based on (Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe, 2000) and (Turney, 2002), we consider four types of structures (as shown in Table 5) during sentiment phrase extraction
clean_text: Based on (Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe, 2000) and (Turney, 2002), we consider four types of structures (as shown in Table 5) during sentiment phrase extraction.

raw_text: Separately, Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe (2000) report a statistical correlation between the number of adjectives in a text and human judgments of subjectivity
clean_text: Separately, Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe (2000) report a statistical correlation between the number of adjectives in a text and human judgments of subjectivity.

raw_text: Subsequently, Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe (2000) showed that automatically detectedgradable adjectives are a useful feature for subjectivity classification, while Wiebe (2000) introduced lexical features in addition to the presence/absence of syntactic categories
clean_text: Subsequently, Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe (2000) showed that automatically detected gradable adjectives are a useful feature for subjectivity classification, while Wiebe (2000) introduced lexical features in addition to the presence/absence of syntactic categories.

raw_text: In addition, the presence of semantically oriented (positive and negative) words in a sentence is an indicator that the sentence is subjective (Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe, 2000)
clean_text: In addition, the presence of semantically oriented (positive and negative) words in a sentence is an indicator that the sentence is subjective (Hatzivassiloglou and Wiebe, 2000).
